questions.text: What is the purpose of a loss function in machine learning?
Explain the concept of overfitting in machine learning. How can you prevent it?
questions.correct_answer: Overfitting occurs when a model learns the training data too well, including its noise. Prevention: regularization, cross-validation, early stopping.

questions.text: Write a Python function to implement linear search:

questions.option_a: Training a model with labeled data

questions.text: What is backpropagation and how does it work in neural networks?
questions.correct_answer: Backpropagation calculates gradients of loss with respect to weights. It propagates error backward through network layers.

questions.text: Which of the following is a reinforcement learning algorithm?
Write a Python function to implement bubble sort:

questions.option_a: An optimization algorithm used to minimize a function

questions.text: Describe the difference between underfitting and overfitting with examples.
questions.correct_answer: Underfitting: Model too simple, fails to capture patterns. Overfitting: Model too complex, memorizes noise.
